value.title: Another City Is Using Crime Control as an Excuse for Facial Recognition Surveillance
value.excerpt: Varanasi in India is installing 3,000 CCTV cameras with automated facial recognition tech at the city’s crossings.

value.title: Facebook’s AI Mistakenly Bans Ads for Struggling Businesses
value.excerpt: New York-based businesswoman Ruth Harrigan usually sells her honey and beeswax products in souvenir shops. But with Covid-19 pausing tourism, she’s been almost entirely dependent on Facebook ads to drive online sales.

value.title: U.S. States Can Succeed in AI by Looking at Singapore

value.title: ECB’s Panetta Open to Case-by-Case Resumption of Bank Dividends
value.excerpt: European Central Bank Executive Board member Fabio Panetta said he’s open to allowing some banks to resume paying dividends as the economy improves.

value.title: China’s Industrial Profits Surge at Fastest Pace in Nine Years

value.title: Bank of Canada says recent COVID-19 vaccine news is promising, recovery to be tough

value.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro says he will not take coronavirus vaccine
value.excerpt: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Thursday evening that he will not take a coronavirus vaccine, the latest in a series of statements he has made expressing skepticism toward coronavirus vaccination programs.

value.excerpt: Finding medicines that can kill cancer cells while leaving normal tissue unscathed is a Holy Grail of oncology research.

value.title: Privacy in China: the growth of facial recognition technology in the private sector raises concerns about security and identity
value.excerpt: Facial recognition is used by Chinese authorities to pick people out of crowds and identify them. Now the technology is moving into the private sector, leading to calls for laws to regulate companies that use it.

value.title: This AI tool generates your creepy lookalikes to trick facial recognition
value.excerpt: If you’re worried about facial recognition firms or stalkers mining your online photos, a new tool called Anonymizer could help you escape their clutches. The app was created by Generated Media, a startup that provides AI-generated pictures to customers ranging from video game developers creating new characters to journalists protecting the identities of sources.

value.title: Playing psychotherapist to a troubled AI in 'Syntherapy'
value.excerpt: Set about 20 years in the future, the game’s narrative is told from the vantage point of Melissa Park, a psychotherapist. The AI, named Willow, feels overwhelmed. The team is torn over whether the illness is a technical issue or an emotional one.
